title: American National Geographic reporter injured in shootout in Mexico while interviewing 'drug dealer'
text:
An American journalist with National Geographic survived a shooting Friday while interviewing two drug dealers, who were assassinated by a hit squad at a drug den in Mexico.

The journalist was part of a group of four from the international magazine, who were on site when the assailants launched the attack at the home in Ciudad Juarez.

According to a statement from the Attorney General's office in the northern part of the state of Chihuahua, the reporter was shot in the leg and taken to a local hospital for treatment.

One drug dealer died on site, while another died in a hospital, according to attorney general Jorge Nava. He said the attackers appeared to be females.

A forensics team investigates the home where an American journalist with National Geographic was wounded during a shooting that left two drug dealers dead

Children film the aftermath of a shooting in northern Mexico following the shooting that wounded a journalist from National Geographic on Friday

The journalist and the remainder of the National Geographic crew departed for El Paso early Saturday after making statements to authorities about the incident.

Nava described the journalists' plan to interview members of organized crime as "obviously risky" and said that two people - allegedly members of criminal groups - had been killed in April at the same house where the journalists had set up television cameras for the interview.

The topic of the report, said Nava, was violence in Ciudad Juarez.

The attorney general added that the National Geographic journalists had previously visited their office to gather information, but never mentioned that they were going to interview the suspected drug dealer.

Mexico is listed as the most dangerous country for journalists in the Western Hemisphere. At least five have been killed this year, according to the Committee to Protect Journalists

The name of the journalist was withheld by Mexican authorities.

DailyMail.com reached out to National Geographic for a request for comment.

The shooting took place almost a month following the murder of a Discovery Channel photography director in the Mexican resort town of Acapulco.

Erick Castillo Sánchez, 46, was vacationing with his wife after recently concluding a project for the Discovery Channel when he was gunned down during a failed carjacking September 11.

The northern border state of Chihuahua is among Mexico's most violent, ranking sixth among the country's 32 departments and entities for homicides in 2018, according to government data.

Mexico is listed as the most dangerous country for journalists in the Western Hemisphere.

The Committee to Protect Journalists says five journalists have been killed in the country this year.
description: An American National Geographic journalist survived a shooting while interviewing drug dealers, who were assassinated by a hit squad at a drug den on Friday in Mexico.
